sections.title: How the population has changed in your area - ONS
sections.description: Demographic trends in local authorities within the UK

sections.title: How the population has changed in the Vale of Glamorgan
sections.label: Select another area to see how the population has changed

sections.content: In 2020, the Vale of Glamorgan was the 11th largest local authority in Wales, with a total population of 135,295. An increase compared with 2019.

sections.title: Population density in the Vale of Glamorgan
sections.content: In 2020, the population density in the Vale of Glamorgan was 409 people per square kilometre, which was more than Wales (153), and more than the United Kingdom as a whole (276).

sections.title: Median age in the Vale of Glamorgan
sections.content: In 2020, the median age in the Vale of Glamorgan was 44 years, which was older than Wales (42 years), and older than the United Kingdom as a whole (41 years).

sections.title: Density in the Vale of Glamorgan and other local authorities in Wales
